element.name: The Massager by AbbeyAckbar, Traditional Cache (1.5/1)

long-description.p: Stretching for about 3 kilometres from Fairview Park to the Bull Wall at Dollymount, the Promenade is 40 metres wide and is about 26.5 hectares in extent. Reclaimed from the sea in the 1920s and finally completed and landscaped in the late 1950s, this much admired amenity is a popular location for a bracing seaside walk with every possibiltiy in the winter or spring of encountering flocks of grazing Brent geese.

At the Clontarf end of the Promenade, near the Dart line is the Children's Traffic School, constructed in 1971 and adjoining it is a well used floodlit all-weather facility for athletics and football. The prominent "Sails" sculpture was added in 1988; the dedicated cycle track in 1997; the memorial seat to Alfie Byrne, former Lord Mayor of Dublin, in 1999; and the 'Maoi' Sculpture near Vernon Avenue in 2004.

Clontarf promenade isn't exactly Venice Muscle Beach, the famous stretch in LA, nevertheless, last November several pieces of exercise equipment were installed along the length of the promenade turning it into a free gym.
There is a cross-trainer, a pulldown trainer, a rider, some parallel bars, a shoulder joint exerciser, a Tai Chi pushing apparatus, and a massager.
The pieces were commissioned by Dublin City Council and have been supplied by a Clontarf-based company called DynamX.
Enjoy exercising with the equipment along the promenade, or enjoy The Massager after a long days caching : )
Please be watchful for muggles, of which there will be plenty!

ul.li:
2010-06-10T19:00:00Z : Found it by njmoore
Wicked, Adam and Carole's 1st geocache whilst visiting Clontarf on a a business trip. Easy find and a lovely walk from the Castle, thank you.

2010-06-05T19:00:00Z : Found it by eve1987
Quick find on a nice, sunny walk!
The massage was great [:)]
TFTC and kind regards from Austria, eve

2010-05-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by tmob
#2404
We looked for this cache during our holidays in Ireland. Six fantastic days, 1800kms driven, and a bunch of caches found. Definitely a great way to get to know this beautiful island!
Wow, a massager! That's what we were needing. Yes, because geocaching is a tiring activity [:D]. Lot's of people enjoying the promenade, running or walking.
Thanks for this one... Greetings from Portugal

2010-05-21T19:00:00Z : Found it by GudrunXY
One look, one grap and I could log. TFTC, GudrunXY

2009-04-20T19:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Such a beautiful evening so we were out for a bike ride. Found this one quickly and took advantage of the facilities! TFTC

wpt.name: GC1KHY3
wpt.desc: The Massager by AbbeyAckbar, Traditional Cache (1.5/1)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: The Massager
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Clontarf Promenade

Stretching for about 3 kilometres from Fairview Park to the Bull Wall at Dollymount, the Promenade is 40 metres wide and is about 26.5 hectares in extent. Reclaimed from the sea in the 1920s and finally completed and landscaped in the late 1950s, this much admired amenity is a popular location for a bracing seaside walk with every possibiltiy in the winter or spring of encountering flocks of grazing Brent geese.

At the Clontarf end of the Promenade, near the Dart line is the Children's Traffic School, constructed in 1971 and adjoining it is a well used floodlit all-weather facility for athletics and football. The prominent "Sails" sculpture was added in 1988; the dedicated cycle track in 1997; the memorial seat to Alfie Byrne, former Lord Mayor of Dublin, in 1999; and the 'Maoi' Sculpture near Vernon Avenue in 2004.

Clontarf promenade isn't exactly Venice Muscle Beach, the famous stretch in LA, nevertheless, last November several pieces of exercise equipment were installed along the length of the promenade turning it into a free gym.

There is a cross-trainer, a pulldown trainer, a rider, some parallel bars, a shoulder joint exerciser, a Tai Chi pushing apparatus, and a massager.

The pieces were commissioned by Dublin City Council and have been supplied by a Clontarf-based company called DynamX.

Enjoy exercising with the equipment along the promenade, or enjoy The Massager after a long days caching : )

Please be watchful for muggles, of which there will be plenty!
